definition.name: NXpulser_apm

symbols.doc: The symbols used in the schema to specify e.g. dimensions of arrays.

definition.doc: Metadata for laser- and/or voltage-pulsing in atom probe microscopy.

field.name: pulse_mode
field.doc: How is field evaporation physically triggered.

field.name: pulse_frequency
field.doc: Frequency with which the high voltage or laser pulser fires.

field.name: pulse_fraction
field.doc: Fraction of the pulse_voltage that is applied in addition to the standing_voltage at peak voltage of a pulse.

field.name: pulsed_voltage
field.doc: In laser pulsing mode the values will be zero so the this field is recommended. However, for voltage pulsing mode it is highly recommended that users report the pulsed_voltage.

field.name: standing_voltage
field.doc: Direct current voltage between the specimen and the (local electrode) in the case of local electrode atom probe (LEAP) instrument.

group.name: laser_gun
group.doc: Atom probe microscopes use controlled laser, voltage, or a combination of pulsing strategies to trigger the excitation and eventual field evaporation/emission of an ion during an experiment.

field.name: wavelength
field.doc: Nominal wavelength of the laser radiation.

field.name: power
field.doc: Nominal power of the laser source while illuminating the specimen.

field.name: pulse_energy
field.doc: Average energy of the laser at peak of each pulse.

group.doc: Affine transformations which describe the geometry how the laser focusing optics/pinhole-attached coordinate system is defined, how it has to be transformed so that it aligns with the specimen coordinate system. A right-handed Cartesian coordinate system, the so-called laser space, should be assumed, whose positive z-axis points into the direction of the propagating laser beam.

group.name: laser_beam
group.doc: Details about specific positions along the focused laser beam which illuminates the (atom probe) specimen.

group.name: pinhole_position
group.doc: Track time-dependent settings over the course of the measurement where the laser beam exits the focusing optics.

group.name: spot_position
group.doc: Track time-dependent settings over the course of the measurement where the laser hits the specimen.
